snippet: The Committee to Save New York, an advocacy group, spent millions to advance Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s agenda last year, but most of the money came from a small number of wealthy donors.
abstract: Documents released by the Committee to Save New York advocacy group show that the organization raised more than $12 million to advance Gov Andrew M Cuomo's agenda in 2011, but most of the money came from just 20 donors.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: The Committee to Save New York, an advocacy group, spent millions to advance Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s agenda last year, but most of the money came from a small number of wealthy donors.

headline.seo: $12 Million to Help Cuomo Came From Just 20 Donors
headline.main: $12 Million to Help Cuomo Came From Just 20 Donors
headline.print_headline: $12 Million to Help Cuomo Came From Just 20 People
